lexicalItems.sourceContext: The extinct thylacine, also known as the Tasmanian Tiger...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã 'extinct' (tuyệt chủng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: No longer existing; having died out.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tuyệt chủng.

phase3Production.content: Dinosaurs have been extinct for about 65 million years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...was a marsupial* that bore a superficial resemblance to a dog.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một loài 'marsupial' (thú có túi) giống như kangaroo hoặc koala.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A type of mammal, such as a kangaroo or koala, whose young are born underdeveloped and are carried in a pouch on the mother's belly.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thú có túi (như kangaroo).

phase3Production.content: The kangaroo is perhaps the most famous marsupial in Australia.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...bore a superficial resemblance to a dog.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bore' (mang) 'resemblance' (sự giống) 'superficial' (bề ngoài) 'to' (với) con chó.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To look similar to something on the surface, but not in a deep or fundamental way. (Past tense of 'bear a resemblance').
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trông giống (cái gì) một cách hời hợt/bề ngoài.

phase3Production.content: The new building bore a superficial resemblance to the classic design, but it was made of modern materials.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Its most distinguishing feature was the 13–19 dark brown stripes...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Feature' (đặc điểm) 'distinguishing' (phân biệt, nổi bật).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A characteristic that makes something clearly different from others of its type.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đặc điểm phân biệt/đặc trưng.

phase3Production.content: The most distinguishing feature of the new phone is its foldable screen.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...beginning at the rear of the body and extending onto the tail.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Kéo dài 'onto' (lên trên) cái đuôi.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To stretch out or continue over a surface (like the tail).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kéo dài/lan ra (lên trên đuôi).

phase3Production.content: The rash started on his arm and is now extending onto his chest.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The thylacine appeared to occupy most types of terrain...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Occupy' (chiếm, sinh sống) ở hầu hết 'types of terrain' (loại địa hình).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To live in or be found across many different kinds of natural land (e.g., forest, desert, mountain).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sinh sống ở/chiếm hầu hết các loại địa hình.

phase3Production.content: This species of lizard can occupy most types of terrain, from dry deserts to wet jungles.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with open eucalyptus forest thought to be its prime habitat.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Habitat' (môi trường sống) 'prime' (chính, chủ yếu, tốt nhất).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The main or most suitable natural environment for an animal or plant.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Môi trường sống chính/lý tưởng.

phase3Production.content: The dense jungle provides the prime habitat for this rare species of monkey.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it was exclusively carnivorous, and its stomach was muscular...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Carnivorous' (ăn thịt) 'exclusively' (một cách duy nhất, hoàn toàn).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Eating only meat and no plants at all.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: (Là loài) ăn thịt độc quyền/hoàn toàn.

phase3Production.content: Lions are exclusively carnivorous, relying on hunting other animals for food.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...its stomach was muscular with an ability to distend so that it could eat large amounts...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dạ dày có 'ability' (khả năng) 'to distend' (giãn ra, phình ra).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The capacity (of an organ, like the stomach) to swell out or expand by pressure from within.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khả năng giãn/phình ra.

phase3Production.content: Snakes have an incredible ability to distend their jaws to swallow large prey.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...an adaptation to compensate for long periods when hunting was unsuccessful...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một sự thích nghi để 'compensate for' (bù đắp cho) những giai đoạn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To provide something good or useful to balance or reduce the bad effects of something (e.g., lack of food).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bù đắp/đền bù cho.

phase3Production.content: He bought her flowers to compensate for being late.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and food scarce.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thức ăn 'scarce' (khan hiếm).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: When there is very little food available; food is difficult to find.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thức ăn khan hiếm.

phase3Production.content: When food is scarce in the winter, many animals hibernate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The thylacine was not a fast runner and probably caught its prey by exhausting it...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Caught' (bắt) 'its prey' (con mồi của nó).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To capture an animal that is hunted and killed for food. (Past tense of 'catch prey').
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bắt con mồi.

phase3Production.content: The spider spun a web and waited until it caught its prey.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...by exhausting it during a long pursuit.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'pursuit' (cuộc rượt đuổi) 'long' (dài).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The act of chasing or following something for an extended period of time.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một cuộc rượt đuổi/truy đuổi kéo dài.

phase3Production.content: The police car was involved in a long pursuit of the stolen vehicle.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...thylacines were likely to have relied more on scent...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Relied more on' (phụ thuộc nhiều hơn vào) 'scent' (mùi hương, khứu giác).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To depend more on the sense of smell (than other senses, like sight).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dựa nhiều hơn vào khứu giác/đánh hơi.

phase3Production.content: Unlike humans, dogs have always relied more on scent to understand the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...tended to retreat to the hills and forest for shelter...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tended to' (có xu hướng) 'retreat to' (lui về) đồi và rừng.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Usually moved back or withdrew to a safe, quiet, or protected place.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có xu hướng lui về/rút về.

phase3Production.content: After the battle, the defeated army tended to retreat to the mountains.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the thylacine had a shy, nervous temperament.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'temperament' (tính khí) 'shy' (nhút nhát) và 'nervous' (hay lo lắng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The natural character or personality of a person or animal, indicating they are easily frightened or worried.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tính khí nhút nhát, hay lo lắng.

phase3Production.content: The small dog had a nervous temperament and barked at every strange sound.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although mainly nocturnal, it was sighted moving during the day...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chủ yếu (mainly) 'nocturnal' (hoạt động về đêm).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Primarily active at night rather than during the day.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chủ yếu hoạt động về đêm.

phase3Production.content: Owls are mainly nocturnal birds, hunting for their prey in the dark.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it was sighted moving during the day...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nó 'was sighted' (được nhìn thấy) đang di chuyển.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Was seen or observed moving (used for rare or difficult-to-see things).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị/được bắt gặp/nhìn thấy đang di chuyển.

phase3Production.content: The rare bird was sighted moving through the forest early this morning.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and some individuals were even recorded basking in the sun.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được ghi nhận là 'basking' (phơi mình) 'in the sun' (dưới nắng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To lie or sit in a place enjoying the warmth, especially from the sun.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phơi nắng, sưởi nắng.

phase3Production.content: We saw several crocodiles basking in the sun on the riverbank.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The thylacine had an extended breeding season from winter to spring...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'breeding season' (mùa sinh sản) 'extended' (kéo dài).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A period of time for animal reproduction that lasts longer than is typical.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mùa sinh sản kéo dài.

phase3Production.content: Due to the warm weather, the birds had an extended breeding season this year.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the thylacine, like all marsupials, was tiny and hairless when born.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhỏ và 'hairless' (không có lông).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having no hair on the body.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không có lông, trần trụi.

phase3Production.content: Newborn mice are pink, blind, and completely hairless.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Newborns crawled into the pouch on the belly of their mother...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: (Con non) 'crawled' (bò) 'into' (vào) 'the pouch' (cái túi).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To move slowly on hands and knees (or by dragging the body) into the external pocket of skin on a marsupial mother.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bò vào túi (của thú mẹ).

phase3Production.content: As soon as it was born, the baby kangaroo crawled into the pouch for safety.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and attached themselves to one of the four teats...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bám vào một trong bốn 'teats' (vú) để bú.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The small, protruding parts on a female mammal's underside through which milk passes to the young; nipples.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vú (của động vật có vú cái).

phase3Production.content: The hungry puppies searched for their mother's teats.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the young stayed in a lair such as a deep rocky cave...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Con non 'stayed in' (ở trong) 'a lair' (cái hang).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To remain in a wild animal's resting or hiding place (e.g., a cave or den).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ở trong hang/sào huyệt.

phase3Production.content: The explorers were afraid they might find a bear sleeping in the lair.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...well-hidden nest or hollow log...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'log' (khúc gỗ) 'hollow' (bị rỗng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A piece of a tree trunk that has fallen and is empty inside.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khúc gỗ rỗng.

phase3Production.content: A family of rabbits made their home inside a large, hollow log.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...whilst the mother hunted.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Whilst' (trong khi) con mẹ đi săn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A conjunction meaning 'during the same time as'; 'while'. More common in British English.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong khi (đồng nghĩa với 'while').

phase3Production.content: He read the newspaper whilst he was waiting for the train.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the thylacine was widespread throughout New Guinea and most of mainland Australia...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Widespread' (phổ biến, lan rộng) 'throughout' (khắp) New Guinea.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Existing or happening in many places; common across a large area.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phổ biến/lan rộng khắp.

phase3Production.content: The use of mobile phones is now widespread throughout the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and most of mainland Australia, as well as the island of Tasmania.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phần 'mainland' (lục địa) của Úc (trái ngược với đảo Tasmania).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The main landmass of the continent of Australia, excluding Tasmania and other islands.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lục địa Úc.

phase3Production.content: She moved from the island to mainland Australia to find work.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The most recent, well-dated occurrence of a thylacine on the mainland...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Occurrence' (sự xuất hiện) 'well-dated' (được xác định niên đại rõ ràng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An instance or event of something existing that has been accurately assigned a date (e.g., through carbon-dating).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự xuất hiện/tồn tại được xác định niên đại rõ ràng.

phase3Production.content: This is the most recent, well-dated occurrence of this type of pottery we have found.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is a carbon-dated fossil from Murray Cave in Western Australia...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'fossil' (hóa thạch) 'carbon-dated' (được xác định niên đại bằng carbon).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The remains of an ancient organism whose age has been determined by measuring the amount of carbon-14 remaining in it.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hóa thạch được xác định niên đại bằng carbon.

phase3Production.content: The carbon-dated fossil revealed that the animal lived over 10,000 years ago.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Its extinction coincided closely with the arrival of wild dogs...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'extinction' (tuyệt chủng) 'coincided closely with' (trùng khớp/xảy ra gần như đồng thời với) sự xuất hiện của chó.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The event of the species dying out happened at almost the exact same time as another event.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tuyệt chủng trùng hợp/trùng khớp với.

phase3Production.content: The company's collapse coincided closely with the new government regulations.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...called dingoes in Australia and a similar predator in New Guinea.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chó 'dingoes' (chó hoang dingo) ở Úc.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A type of wild dog found in Australia.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chó hoang dingo.

phase3Production.content: Dingoes are native to Australia and are known for their distinctive howl.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a similar predator in New Guinea.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'predator' (động vật săn mồi) tương tự.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An animal that naturally preys on (hunts) others.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Động vật/thú săn mồi.

phase3Production.content: The lion is a dangerous predator at the top of the food chain.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: see this as the main reason for
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and most scientists see this as the main reason for the thylacine's survival there.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các nhà khoa học 'see this as' (xem đây là) 'the main reason for' (lý do chính cho) sự sống sót.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To view or consider something as the primary cause of an outcome.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xem đây là lý do chính cho.

phase3Production.content: Most doctors see poor diet as the main reason for the increase in heart disease.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the main reason for the thylacine's survival there.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lý do chính cho 'survival' (sự sống sót/tồn tại) của nó ở đó (Tasmania, vì dingo không đến được).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The state of continuing to live or exist, often despite difficult conditions or danger.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự sống sót, sự tồn tại.

phase3Production.content: The tiny plant's survival in the desert is remarkable.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The dramatic decline of the thylacine in Tasmania...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'decline' (suy giảm) 'dramatic' (nghiêm trọng, đột ngột).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very large, sudden, and serious decrease in the number of something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự sụt giảm nghiêm trọng/đột ngột.

phase3Production.content: There has been a dramatic decline in the bee population in recent years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is generally attributed to the relentless efforts of sheep farmers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thường 'attributed to' (được cho là do, quy cho là do) nỗ lực của nông dân.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be usually thought of as being caused by a particular person, event, or situation.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thường được cho là do/quy cho là do.

phase3Production.content: The team's success is generally attributed to their new manager.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the relentless efforts of sheep farmers and bounty hunters...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'efforts' (nỗ lực) 'relentless' (không ngừng, không-na-núng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Continuous, determined, and severe efforts that never stop or become less intense.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những nỗ lực không ngừng/không-na-núng.

phase3Production.content: The species was hunted to extinction through the relentless efforts of poachers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...sheep farmers and bounty hunters** with shotguns.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thợ săn 'bounty' (tiền thưởng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People who hunt animals (or capture criminals) for a reward (a bounty).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thợ săn tiền thưởng.

phase3Production.content: In the old days, bounty hunters were paid for every wolf they killed.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: While this determined campaign undoubtedly played a large part...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'campaign' (chiến dịch) 'determined' (kiên quyết).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A series of planned activities taken with strong resolution and purpose to achieve a specific goal.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chiến dịch (đầy) kiên quyết.

phase3Production.content: The government launched a determined campaign to stop illegal hunting.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...undoubtedly played a large part, it is likely that...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã 'played a large part' (đóng một vai trò lớn) (trong việc gì đó).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be a significant or major factor in causing a particular result. (Past tense of 'play a large part').
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đóng một vai trò/phần lớn (trong).

phase3Production.content: His hard work played a large part in the success of the project.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and eventual extinction of the species.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'extinction' (tuyệt chủng) 'eventual' (cuối cùng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The final result of dying out completely, happening at the end of a long process.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tuyệt chủng cuối cùng.

phase3Production.content: Pollution and habitat loss led to the eventual extinction of the dodo.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...wild dogs introduced by European settlers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'settlers' (người định cư) 'European' (châu Âu).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People from Europe who came to live permanently in a new country, often one that was previously uninhabited or inhabited by indigenous people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người định cư châu Âu.

phase3Production.content: Early European settlers in America faced many hardships.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...loss of habitat along with the disappearance of prey species...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'loss' (mất) 'habitat' (môi trường sống).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The destruction or disappearance of the natural environment where an animal or plant normally lives.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự mất môi trường sống.

phase3Production.content: Deforestation is the primary cause of habitat loss for many species.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and a distemper-like disease which may also have affected the thylacine.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'disease' (căn bệnh) 'distemper-like' (giống như bệnh sài sốt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An illness that resembles distemper, which is a serious viral disease affecting animals (especially dogs).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một căn bệnh giống bệnh sài sốt.

phase3Production.content: The fox population was reduced by a distemper-like disease.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There was only one successful attempt to breed a thylacine in captivity...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Breed' (nhân giống) một con thylacine 'in captivity' (trong điều kiện nuôi nhốt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make animals have babies while they are kept in a zoo, park, or enclosure, rather than in their natural habitat.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhân giống (loài gì) trong điều kiện nuôi nhốt.

phase3Production.content: Pandas are notoriously difficult to breed in captivity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...naturalist John Gould foresaw the thylacine's demise when he published...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhà tự nhiên học 'foresaw' (thấy trước) 'demise' (sự lụi tàn/cái chết) của thylacine.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To predict or see in advance that a species (or person/organization) would come to an end, die, or fail.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thấy/biết trước sự lụi tàn/cái chết của thylacine.

phase3Production.content: The CEO foresaw the company's demise if they didn't adapt to new technology.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...when this singular animal will speedily diminish...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Loài 'animal' (động vật) 'singular' (đặc biệt, độc đáo, duy nhất).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An animal that is unique, remarkable, or extraordinary.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Loài động vật đặc biệt/độc đáo.

phase3Production.content: The platypus is a truly singular animal, being a mammal that lays eggs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this singular animal will speedily diminish...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sẽ 'diminish' (suy giảm) 'speedily' (một cách nhanh chóng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To decrease in number, size, or importance very quickly.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Suy giảm nhanh chóng.

phase3Production.content: The funds for the project began to speedily diminish after the main sponsor pulled out.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: extermination will have its full sway
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...extermination will have its full sway, and it will then...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'extermination' (tuyệt diệt) sẽ 'have its full sway' (diễn ra trọn vẹn, thống trị hoàn toàn).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The complete destruction of a species will be totally dominant or have its full effect.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tuyệt diệt sẽ diễn ra trọn vẹn/hoàn toàn.

phase3Production.content: By the 1900s, it was clear that the extermination of the species would soon have its full sway.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...be recorded as an animal of the past.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'animal' (loài vật) 'of the past' (của quá khứ) -> đã tuyệt chủng.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An animal that no longer exists; an extinct species.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một loài vật của quá khứ (đã tuyệt chủng).

phase3Production.content: The dodo is now just an animal of the past, known only from books and drawings.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, there seems to have been little public pressure to preserve the thylacine...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Rất ít 'public pressure' (áp lực dư luận) 'to preserve' (để bảo tồn).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Efforts or influence from the general population demanding that something be protected or saved.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Áp lực/sức ép dư luận đòi bảo tồn.

phase3Production.content: There is growing public pressure to preserve the ancient forest from development.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...nor was much concern expressed by scientists at the decline...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không có nhiều 'concern' (sự lo ngại) 'expressed' (được bày tỏ) 'by' (bởi) các nhà khoa học.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Worry or anxiety that is shown or stated by scientific experts.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự lo ngại được các nhà khoa học bày tỏ.

phase3Production.content: The report highlights the serious concern expressed by scientists about climate change.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A notable exception was T.T. Flynn...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'exception' (ngoại lệ) 'notable' (đáng chú ý).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A significant or important person or thing that does not follow the general rule or trend.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một ngoại lệ đáng chú ý.

phase3Production.content: Most students were late, with the exception of Maria, who was a notable exception.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...he was sufficiently concerned about the scarcity of the thylacine...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lo ngại về 'scarcity' (sự khan hiếm) của thylacine.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The state of the thylacine being rare, in small numbers, or difficult to find.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự khan hiếm của loài thylacine.

phase3Production.content: The scarcity of the thylacine in the wild was a clear sign of its impending extinction.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: on the very edge of extinction
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with the species on the very edge of extinction, that Tasmania's... Board passed a motion...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Loài vật 'on the very edge' (ngay trên bờ vực) 'of extinction' (của sự tuyệt chủng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Extremely close to becoming extinct; critically endangered.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trên chính bờ vực tuyệt chủng.

phase3Production.content: The white rhino is on the very edge of extinction, with only a few individuals left.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Tasmania's Animals and Birds Protection Board passed a motion protecting thylacines...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Passed' (thông qua) 'a motion' (một kiến nghị/nghị quyết) 'protecting' (bảo vệ).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To formally approve a proposal or law (in a meeting) that legally safeguards something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thông qua một kiến nghị/nghị quyết bảo vệ.

phase3Production.content: The city council passed a motion protecting the historic building from demolition.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which was thought to be their prime breeding season.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Breeding season' (mùa sinh sản) 'prime' (chính, tốt nhất).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The main or most active time of year when a species reproduces.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mùa sinh sản chính.

phase3Production.content: Spring is the prime breeding season for many species of birds.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The last known wild thylacine to be killed was shot...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Con thylacine 'wild' (hoang dã) 'last known' (cuối cùng được biết đến).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The final individual of the species living in its natural habitat (not in a zoo) that was recorded by people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cá thể thylacine hoang dã cuối cùng được biết đến.

phase3Production.content: The last known wild passenger pigeon died in 1900.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...leaving just captive specimens.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chỉ còn lại 'specimens' (mẫu vật, cá thể) 'captive' (bị nuôi nhốt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Individual animals that are kept in zoos or enclosures (not in the wild).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các cá thể/mẫu vật bị nuôi nhốt.

phase3Production.content: The zoo has several captive specimens of the endangered species.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Official protection of the species by the Tasmanian government...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'protection' (bảo vệ) 'Official' (chính thức) (từ chính phủ).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Legal protection given by a government or another group in authority.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự bảo vệ chính thức (từ chính quyền).

phase3Production.content: The ancient site was granted official protection after archaeologists discovered its importance.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...59 days before the last known individual died in Hobart Zoo...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Individual' (cá thể) cuối cùng 'died' (đã chết).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The last single animal of its species passed away.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cá thể (cuối cùng) đã chết.

phase3Production.content: The last known individual of the species died in captivity in 2018.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There have been numerous expeditions and searches for the thylacine...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã có 'numerous' (nhiều) 'expeditions' (cuộc thám hiểm).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Many organized journeys or trips made for a particular purpose, such as exploration or scientific research.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhiều cuộc thám hiểm.

phase3Production.content: There have been numerous expeditions to find the lost city of Atlantis.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...none of which has produced definitive evidence that thylacines still exist.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không có cái nào 'produced' (đưa ra) 'definitive evidence' (bằng chứng cuối cùng/rõ ràng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To provide proof that is final, conclusive, and cannot be questioned or doubted.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đưa ra bằng chứng cuối cùng/chắc chắn.

phase3Production.content: The investigation has not yet produced definitive evidence of who committed the crime.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The species was declared extinct by the Tasmanian government in 1986.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'declared' (tuyên bố) 'extinct' (tuyệt chủng).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be officially and formally announced as being extinct.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị tuyên bố (là đã) tuyệt chủng.

phase3Production.content: The passenger pigeon was declared extinct in 1914 after the last one died in a zoo.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q1 (Summary): ate an entirely 1 ............ diet (Answer: carnivorous)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ăn một chế độ ăn 'hoàn toàn' (entirely) ... (ăn thịt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'entirely' with the word 'exclusively'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'entirely' (hoàn toàn) với từ 'exclusively' (duy nhất).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'an entirely... diet' 
<->
Passage: 'exclusively carnivorous'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q2 (Summary): probably depended mainly on 2 ............ when hunting (Answer: scent)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phụ thuộc 'chủ yếu' (mainly) vào ... [khứu giác] khi đi săn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'depended mainly on' with 'relied more on'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'depended mainly on' (phụ thuộc chủ yếu vào) với 'relied more on' (dựa nhiều hơn vào).

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'depended mainly on...' 
<->
Passage: 'relied more on...'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: spent first months of life inside its mother's 3 ............
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q3 (Summary): young spent first months of life inside its mother's 3 ............ (Answer: pouch)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Con non trải qua những tháng đầu đời bên trong ... [cái túi] của mẹ.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'young spent first months' with 'Newborns... remaining there for up to three months'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'con non trải qua những tháng đầu' với 'Con non... ở đó cho đến ba tháng'.
relatedCollocates: remaining there for up to three months

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'spent first months... inside... mother's...' 
<->
Passage: 'Newborns crawled into the pouch... remaining there for... months'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q4 (Summary): last evidence... is a 3,100-year-old 4 ............ (Answer: fossil)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bằng chứng cuối cùng... là một ... [hóa thạch] 3.100 năm tuổi.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'last evidence' with 'most recent, well-dated occurrence'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'last evidence' (bằng chứng cuối cùng) với 'most recent, well-dated occurrence' (sự xuất hiện gần nhất, được xác định niên đại rõ ràng).
relatedCollocates: most recent... occurrence (synonym for last evidence)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'last evidence... 3,100-year-old...' 
<->
Passage: 'most recent... occurrence... carbon-dated fossil... 3,100 years old'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: reduction in 5 ............ and available sources of food
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q5 (Summary): reduction in 5 ............ and available sources of food... responsible for decline... (Answer: habitat)

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự sụt giảm về ... [môi trường sống] và nguồn thức ăn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'reduction in' with 'loss of' and 'available sources of food' with 'disappearance of prey species'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'reduction in' (sự giảm sút) với 'loss of' (sự mất) và 'available sources of food' (nguồn thức ăn có sẵn) với 'disappearance of prey species' (sự biến mất của loài mồi).
relatedCollocates: disappearance of prey species (synonym for sources of food)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'reduction in... and... sources of food' 
<->
Passage: 'loss of habitat along with the disappearance of prey species'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: Significant numbers of... killed by humans
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q6 (T/F/NG): Significant numbers of thylacines were killed by humans from the 1830s onwards.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Một số lượng đáng kể' (Significant numbers) bị 'con người' (humans) giết.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'Significant numbers... killed by humans' with passage text.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'Significant numbers... killed by humans' (Số lượng đáng kể... bị con người giết) với nội dung bài đọc.

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'Significant numbers... killed by humans' 
<->
Passage: 'dramatic decline... attributed to... relentless efforts of sheep farmers and bounty hunters'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: Several thylacines were born in zoos
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q7 (T/F/NG): Several thylacines were born in zoos during the late 1800s.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Một vài' (Several) con thylacine 'được sinh ra' (were born) 'trong sở thú' (in zoos).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'Several... born in zoos' with 'only one successful attempt to breed... in captivity'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'Several... born in zoos' (Một vài... sinh ra ở sở thú) với 'only one successful attempt to breed... in captivity' (chỉ một nỗ lực nhân giống thành công... trong nuôi nhốt).
relatedCollocates: breed... in captivity (synonym for born in zoos)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'Several... were born in zoos' 
<->
Passage: 'only one successful attempt to breed... in captivity'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q8 (T/F/NG): John Gould's prediction about the thylacine surprised some biologists.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Dự đoán' (prediction) của John Gould 'làm ngạc nhiên' (surprised) 'một số nhà sinh vật học' (some biologists).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Checks if 'surprised some biologists' is mentioned in relation to the 'prediction'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: Kiểm tra xem 'surprised some biologists' (làm ngạc nhiên một số nhà sinh vật học) có được đề cập liên quan đến 'prediction' (dự đoán) hay không.
relatedCollocates: foresaw the thylacine's demise (synonym for prediction)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'prediction... surprised some biologists' 
<->
Passage: 'foresaw the thylacine's demise' (Phản ứng/sự ngạc nhiên không được đề cập)

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q9 (T/F/NG): In the early 1900s, many scientists became worried about the possible extinction...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhiều 'nhà khoa học' (scientists) 'trở nên lo lắng' (became worried).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'many scientists became worried' with 'nor was much concern expressed by scientists'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'many scientists became worried' (nhiều nhà khoa học trở nên lo lắng) với 'nor was much concern expressed by scientists' (không có nhiều lo ngại được các nhà khoa học bày tỏ).
relatedCollocates: nor was much concern expressed by scientists

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'many scientists became worried' 
<->
Passage: 'nor was much concern expressed by scientists'

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q10 (T/F/NG): T.T. Flynn's proposal to rehome captive thylacines... proved to be impractical.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đề xuất' (proposal) của T.T. Flynn 'chứng tỏ là' (proved to be) 'không thực tế' (impractical).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Checks if the 'proposal' was described as 'impractical'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: Kiểm tra xem 'proposal' (đề xuất) có được mô tả là 'impractical' (không thực tế) hay không.
relatedCollocates: suggested that some should be captured... (synonym for proposal)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'proposal... proved to be impractical' 
<->
Passage: 'suggested that some should be captured...' (Kết quả/tính thực tế không được đề cập)

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: reasonable numbers... in existence when... protection... was passed
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q11 (T/F/NG): There were still reasonable numbers of thylacines in existence when a piece of legislation protecting the species... was passed.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Vẫn còn 'số lượng hợp lý' (reasonable numbers) khi 'luật bảo vệ' (legislation protecting) được thông qua.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'reasonable numbers' with 'on the very edge of extinction'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'reasonable numbers' (số lượng hợp lý) với 'on the very edge of extinction' (trên chính bờ vực tuyệt chủng).
relatedCollocates: on the very edge of extinction
passed a motion protecting (synonym for legislation... was passed)

phase3Production.content:
Question: 'reasonable numbers... in existence' 
<->
Passage: 'on the very edge of extinction'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: only known living thylacines were all in captivity
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q12 (T/F/NG): From 1930 to 1936, the only known living thylacines were all in captivity.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Từ 1930-1936, 'những con thylacine sống duy nhất được biết đến' (only known living thylacines) 'đều ở trong tình trạng nuôi nhốt' (all in captivity).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'only known living... all in captivity' with 'last known wild... in 1930, leaving just captive specimens'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'only known living... all in captivity' (chỉ những con sống... đều bị nuôi nhốt) với 'last known wild... in 1930, leaving just captive specimens' (con hoang dã cuối cùng... vào 1930, chỉ còn lại các cá thể nuôi nhốt).

phase3Production.content:
Question: '...only known living... were all in captivity' 
<->
Passage: 'last known wild... in 1930, leaving just captive specimens'

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: Attempts to find... are now rarely made
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Q13 (T/F/NG): Attempts to find living thylacines are now rarely made.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'nỗ lực tìm kiếm' (Attempts to find) bây giờ 'hiếm khi được thực hiện' (rarely made).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Focus: Compares 'rarely made' with 'numerous expeditions and searches'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng tâm: So sánh 'rarely made' (hiếm khi được thực hiện) với 'numerous expeditions and searches' (rất nhiều cuộc thám hiểm và tìm kiếm).

phase3Production.content:
Question: '...are now rarely made' 
<->
Passage: 'There have been numerous expeditions...'
